alert.note: Alert for Hardin; Southern Jasper; Southern Newton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 15 at 2:36PM CST until January 17 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 11 AM CST TUESDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM TUESDAY TO 6 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, freezing rain. Additional ice accumulations of a light glaze. For the first Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 5 above zero. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 10 above zero. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Louisiana and southeast Texas. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until midnight CST tonight. For the first Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to 11 AM CST Tuesday. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, from 8 PM Tuesday to 6 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Very slippery sidewalks, roads and bridges are possible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. In Louisiana, call 511 for road information. In Texas, visit www.drivetexas.org for road information.
